$comment: OSCAL Unified Model of Models: JSON Schema

oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:catalog.title: Catalog
oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:catalog.description: A structured, organized collection of control information.

uuid.title: Catalog Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given catalog instance.

oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:group.title: Control Group
oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:group.description: A group of controls, or of groups of controls.

id.title: Group Identifier
id.description: Identifies the group for the purpose of cross-linking within the defining instance or from other instances that reference the catalog.

class.title: Group Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the group.

title.title: Group Title
title.description: A name given to the group, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:control.title: Control
oscal-complete-oscal-catalog:control.description: A structured object representing a requirement or guideline, which when implemented will reduce an aspect of risk related to an information system and its information.

id.title: Control Identifier
id.description: Identifies a control such that it can be referenced in the defining catalog and other OSCAL instances (e.g., profiles).

class.title: Control Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the control.

title.title: Control Title
title.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

mapping.title: Mapping
mapping.description: A mapping between the containing control and another resource.

uuid.title: Mapping Identifier
uuid.description: The unique identifier for the mapping.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:part.title: Part
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:part.description: An annotated, markup-based textual element of a control's or catalog group's definition, or a child of another part.

id.title: Part Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the part.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type, which exists in a value space qualified by the ns.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: An optional namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: An optional textual providing a sub-type or characterization of the part's name, or a category to which the part belongs.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: An optional name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.title: Parameter
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.description: Parameters provide a mechanism for the dynamic assignment of value(s) in a control.

id.title: Parameter Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the parameter.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the type, purpose, use or scope of the parameter.

depends-on.title: Depends on
depends-on.description: (deprecated) Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.title: Constraint
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test.

description.title: Constraint Description
description.description: A textual summary of the constraint to be applied.

items.title: Constraint Test
items.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

expression.title: Constraint test
expression.description: A formal (executable) expression of a constraint.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.title: Guideline
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

prose.title: Guideline Text
prose.description: Prose permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.title: Parameter Value
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:para.description: A parameter value or set of values.

how-many.title: Parameter Cardinality
how-many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

items.title: Choice
items.description: A value selection among several such options.

oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:incl.title: Include All
oscal-complete-oscal-control-common:incl.description: Include all controls from the imported catalog or profile resources.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:metadata.title: Document Metadata
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:metadata.description: Provides information about the containing document, and defines concepts that are shared across the document.

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Revision History Entry
items.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document, expected to be in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest first).

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Role
items.description: Defines a function, which might be assigned to a party in a specific situation.

id.title: Role Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the role.

title.title: Role Title
title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: Role Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.title: Role Description
description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

items.title: Location
items.description: A physical point of presence, which may be associated with people, organizations, or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique ID for the location, for reference.

title.title: Location Title
title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Location URL
items.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or other resource associated with the location.

items.title: Party
items.description: An organization or person, which may be associated with roles or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for the party.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short-name.title: Party Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: A reference to another party by UUID, typically an organization, that this subject is associated with.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:location-u.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier Reference
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:location-u.description: Reference to a location by UUID.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier Reference
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:role-id.title: Role Identifier Reference
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:role-id.description: Reference to a role by UUID.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:back-matte.title: Back matter
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:back-matte.description: A collection of resources that may be referenced from within the OSCAL document instance.

items.title: Resource
items.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document instance. A resource may be directly included in the document using base64 encoding or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

uuid.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

title.title: Resource Title
title.description: An optional name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: An optional short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: An optional citation consisting of end note text using structured markup.

items.title: Resource link
items.description: A URL-based pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL pointing to the referenced resource.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

base64.title: Base64
base64.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by RFC 2045.

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a resource. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:property.title: Property
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

name.title: Property Name
name.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a property.

ns.title: Property Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.title: Property Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.title: Property Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name.

group.title: Property Group
group.description: An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:link.title: Link
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Link Relation Type
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:responsibl.title: Responsible Party
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:responsibl.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

role-id.title: Responsible Role
role-id.description: A reference to a role performed by a party.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:action.title: Action
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:action.description: An action applied by a role within a given party to the content.

uuid.title: Action Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined action elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

date.title: Action Occurrence Date
date.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

type.title: Action Type
type.description: The type of action documented by the assembly, such as an approval.

system.title: Action Type System
system.description: Specifies the action type system used.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:responsibl.title: Responsible Role
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:responsibl.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

role-id.title: Responsible Role ID
role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a role performed.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:hash.title: Hash
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description: The digest method by which a hash is derived.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:remarks.title: Remarks
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:published.title: Publication Timestamp
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:published.description: The date and time the document was last made available.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:last-modif.title: Last Modified Timestamp
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:last-modif.description: The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:version.title: Document Version
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:version.description: Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:oscal-vers.title: OSCAL Version
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:oscal-vers.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:email-addr.title: Email Address
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:email-addr.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:telephone-.title: Telephone Number
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:telephone-.description: A telephone service number as defined by ITU-T E.164.

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:address.title: Address
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:address.description: A postal address for the location.

city.title: City
city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.title: State
state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for a mailing address.

postal-code.title: Postal Code
postal-code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:addr-line.title: Address line
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:addr-line.description: A single line of an address.

oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:document-i.title: Document Identifier
oscal-complete-oscal-metadata:document-i.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:map.title: Mapping Entry
oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:map.description: A relationship-based mapping between a source and target set consisting of members (i.e., controls, control statements) from the respective source and target.

uuid.title: Mapping Entry Identifier
uuid.description: The unique identifier for the mapping entry.

relationship.title: Mapping Entry Relationship
relationship.description: The relationship type for the mapping entry, which describes the relationship between the effective requirements of the specified source and target sets.

ns.title: Relationship Value Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the relationship's value. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics for relationships with the same name.

oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:mapp.title: Mapping Entry Item (source or target)
oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:mapp.description: Identifies a specific edge within a source or target that is the subject of a mapping.

type.title: Subject Type
type.description: The semantic type of the subject.

id-ref.title: Subject Identifier Reference
id-ref.description: A reference to an identified subject that is of the specified type.

oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:mapp.title: Mapped Resource Reference
oscal-complete-oscal-mapping-common:mapp.description: A reference to a resource that is either the source or target of a mapping.

type.title: Resource Type
type.description: The semantic type of the resource.

href.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

oscal-complete-oscal-mapping:mapping-col.title: Mapping Collection
oscal-complete-oscal-mapping:mapping-col.description: A collection of relationship-based control and/or control statement mappings.

uuid.title: Mapping Collection Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope for this catalog instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

oscal-complete-oscal-mapping:mapping.title: Control Mapping
oscal-complete-oscal-mapping:mapping.description: A mapping between two target resources.

uuid.title: Mapping Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this mapping definition elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the mapping can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same mapping across revisions of the document.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:profile.title: Profile
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:profile.description: Each OSCAL profile is defined by a profile element.

uuid.title: Profile Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given profile instance.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:import.title: Import Resource
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:import.description: Designates a referenced source catalog or profile that provides a source of control information for use in creating a new overlay or baseline.

href.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:merge.title: Merge Controls
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:merge.description: Provides structuring directives that instruct how controls are organized after profile resolution.

combine.title: Combination Rule
combine.description: A Combine element defines how to resolve duplicate instances of the same control (e.g., controls with the same ID).

method.title: Combination Method
method.description: Declare how clashing controls should be handled.

flat.title: Flat Without Grouping
flat.description: Directs that controls appear without any grouping structure.

as-is.title: Group As-Is
as-is.description: Indicates that the controls selected should retain their original grouping as defined in the import source.

custom.title: Custom Grouping
custom.description: Provides an alternate grouping structure that selected controls will be placed in.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:group.title: Control Group
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:group.description: A group of (selected) controls or of groups of controls.

class.title: Group Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the group.

title.title: Group Title
title.description: A name to be given to the group for use in display.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:modify.title: Modify Controls
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:modify.description: Set parameters or amend controls in resolution.

items.title: Parameter Setting
items.description: A parameter setting, to be propagated to points of insertion.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

depends-on.title: Depends On
depends-on.description: **(deprecated)** Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter.

items.title: Alteration
items.description: Specifies changes to be made to an included control when a profile is resolved.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

items.title: Removal
items.description: Specifies objects to be removed from a control based on specific aspects of the object that must all match.

by-name.title: Reference by (assigned) name
by-name.description: Identify items remove by matching their assigned name.

by-class.title: Reference by class
by-class.description: Identify items to remove by matching their class.

by-id.title: Reference by ID
by-id.description: Identify items to remove indicated by their id.

by-item-name.title: Item Name Reference
by-item-name.description: Identify items to remove by the name of the item's information object name, e.g. title or prop.

by-ns.title: Item Namespace Reference
by-ns.description: Identify items to remove by the item's ns, which is the namespace associated with a part, or prop.

items.title: Addition
items.description: Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution.

position.title: Position
position.description: Where to add the new content with respect to the targeted element (beside it or inside it).

title.title: Title Change
title.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:insert-cont.title: Select Controls
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:insert-cont.description: Specifies which controls to use in the containing context.

order.title: Order
order.description: A designation of how a selection of controls in a profile is to be ordered.

oscal-complete-oscal-profile:select-cont.title: Select Control
oscal-complete-oscal-profile:select-cont.description: Select a control or controls from an imported control set.

with-child-controls.title: Include Contained Controls with Control
with-child-controls.description: When a control is included, whether its child (dependent) controls are also included.

items.title: Match Controls by Identifier
items.description: Selecting a control by its ID given as a literal.

items.title: Match Controls by Pattern
items.description: Selecting a set of controls by matching their IDs with a wildcard pattern.

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: A glob expression matching the IDs of one or more controls to be selected.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Component Definition
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: A collection of component descriptions, which may optionally be grouped by capability.

uuid.title: Component Definition Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given component definition instance.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Import Component Definition
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: Loads a component definition from another resource.

href.title: Hyperlink Reference
href.description: A link to a resource that defines a set of components and/or capabilities to import into this collection.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Component
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.title: Component Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given component.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Capability
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: A grouping of other components and/or capabilities.

uuid.title: Capability Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given capability.

description.title: Capability Description
description.description: A summary of the capability.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Incorporates Component
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: The collection of components comprising this capability.

component-uuid.title: Component Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Control Implementation Set
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: Defines how the component or capability supports a set of controls.

uuid.title: Control Implementation Set Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a means to identify a set of control implementations that are supported by a given component or capability.

source.title: Source Resource Reference
source.description: A reference to an OSCAL catalog or profile providing the referenced control or subcontrol definition.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A description of how the specified set of controls are implemented for the containing component or capability.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Control Implementation
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: Describes how the containing component or capability implements an individual control.

uuid.title: Control Implementation Identifier
uuid.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given control implementation by a component.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A suggestion from the supplier (e.g., component vendor or author) for how the specified control may be implemented if the containing component or capability is instantiated in a system security plan.

oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.title: Control Statement Implementation
oscal-complete-oscal-component-definitio.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

statement-id.title: Control Statement Reference
statement-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a control statement.

uuid.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The UUID of the control statement in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

description.title: Statement Implementation Description
description.description: A summary of how the containing control statement is implemented by the component or capability.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Component
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.title: Component Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this component elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the component can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the system component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

status.title: Status
status.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Service Protocol Information
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

uuid.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this service protocol information elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the service protocol can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

name.title: Protocol Name
name.description: The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

title.title: Protocol Title
title.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Port Range
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

start.title: Start
start.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range

end.title: End
end.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Implementation Status
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

state.title: Implementation State
state.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: System User
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

uuid.title: User Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this user class elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the system user can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: User Title
title.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: User Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

description.title: User Description
description.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Privilege
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

title.title: Privilege Title
title.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

description.title: Privilege Description
description.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Functions Performed
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Inventory Item
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

uuid.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inventory item elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inventory item can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Inventory Item Description
description.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

items.title: Implemented Component
items.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: Set Parameter Value
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

param-id.title: Parameter ID
param-id.description: A human-oriented reference to a parameter within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

items.title: Parameter Value
items.description: A parameter value or set of values.

oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.title: System Identification
oscal-complete-oscal-implementation-comm.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referencing an externally defined system identification, the system identification must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

identifier-type.title: Identification System Type
identifier-type.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-security.title: System Security Plan (SSP)
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-security.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18

uuid.title: System Security Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system security plan (SSP) elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the SSP can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:import-profile.title: Import Profile
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:import-profile.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

href.title: Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the profile or catalog to use as the system's control baseline.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-characte.title: System Characteristics
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-characte.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

system-name.title: System Name - Full
system-name.description: The full name of the system.

system-name-short.title: System Name - Short
system-name-short.description: A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

description.title: System Description
description.description: A summary of the system.

security-sensitivity-level.title: Security Sensitivity Level
security-sensitivity-level.description: The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by FIPS-199.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-informat.title: System Information
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-informat.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

items.title: Information Type
items.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

uuid.title: Information Type Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this information type elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the information type can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: title field
title.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

description.title: Information Type Description
description.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

items.title: Information Type Categorization
items.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

system.title: Information Type Identification System
system.description: Specifies the information type identification system used.

items.title: Information Type Systematized Identifier
items.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60. This identifier has cross-instance scope and can be used to reference this system elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:impact.title: Impact Level
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:base.title: Base Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:base.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:selected.title: Selected Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:selected.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:adjustment-just.title: Adjustment Justification
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:adjustment-just.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:security-impact.title: Security Impact Level
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:security-impact.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

security-objective-confidentiality.title: Security Objective: Confidentiality
security-objective-confidentiality.description: A target-level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security-objective-integrity.title: Security Objective: Integrity
security-objective-integrity.description: A target-level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security-objective-availability.title: Security Objective: Availability
security-objective-availability.description: A target-level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:status.title: Status
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:status.description: Describes the operational status of the system.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:date-authorized.title: System Authorization Date
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:date-authorized.description: The date the system received its authorization.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:authorization-b.title: Authorization Boundary
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:authorization-b.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

description.title: Authorization Boundary Description
description.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:diagram.title: Diagram
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:diagram.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

uuid.title: Diagram ID
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this diagram elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the diagram can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Diagram Description
description.description: A summary of the diagram.

caption.title: Caption
caption.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:network-archite.title: Network Architecture
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:network-archite.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

description.title: Network Architecture Description
description.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:data-flow.title: Data Flow
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:data-flow.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

description.title: Data Flow Description
description.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-implemen.title: System Implementation
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:system-implemen.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

items.title: Leveraged Authorization
items.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a common control provider.

uuid.title: Leveraged Authorization Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope and can be used to reference this leveraged authorization elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the leveraged authorization can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: title field
title.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

party-uuid.title: party-uuid field
party-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the party that manages the leveraged system.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:control-impleme.title: Control Implementation
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:control-impleme.description: Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:implemented-req.title: Control-based Requirement
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:implemented-req.description: Describes how the system satisfies the requirements of an individual control.

uuid.title: Control Requirement Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this control requirement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the control requirement can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:statement.title: Specific Control Statement
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:statement.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

statement-id.title: Control Statement Reference
statement-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a control statement.

uuid.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The UUID of the control statement in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:by-component.title: Component Control Implementation
oscal-complete-oscal-ssp:by-component.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the component that is implemeting a given control.

uuid.title: By-Component Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this by-component entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the by-component entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

export.title: Export
export.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

description.title: Control Implementation Export Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

items.title: Provided Control Implementation

uuid.title: Provided Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the provided entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Provided Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

items.title: Control Implementation Responsibility
items.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

uuid.title: Responsibility Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this responsibility elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the responsibility can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). provided-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

description.title: Control Implementation Responsibility Description

items.title: Inherited Control Implementation

uuid.title: Inherited Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inherited control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

provided-uuid.title: Provided UUID
provided-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

description.title: Inherited Control Implementation Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

items.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility
items.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

uuid.title: Satisfied Universally Unique Identifier

The locally defined UUID of the control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

responsibility-uuid.title: Responsibility UUID
responsibility-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a control implementation that satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

description.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility Description
description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

oscal-complete-oscal-ap:assessment-plan.title: Security Assessment Plan (SAP)

uuid.title: Assessment Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment plan in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the assessment plan can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). local-definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:l.title: Assessment-Specific Control Objective
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:l.description: A local definition of a control objective for this assessment. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment actions.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

description.title: Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this control objective.

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.title: Assessment Method
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.description: A local definition of a control objective. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment activities.

uuid.title: Assessment Method Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment method elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the assessment method can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Assessment Method Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this assessment method.

In the assessment plan, this is an intended activity which may be associated with an assessment task. In the assessment results, this an activity that was actually performed as part of an assessment.

uuid.title: Assessment Activity Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment activity elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the activity can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). title.title: Included Activity Title
title.description: The title for this included activity.

description.title: Included Activity Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this included activity.

items.title: Step

uuid.title: Step Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this step elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. title.title: Step Title
title.description: The title for this step.

description.title: Step Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this step.

uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this task elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. title.title: Task Title
title.description: The title for this task.

description.title: Task Description

timing.title: Event Timing
timing.description: The timing under which the task is intended to occur.

on-date.title: On Date Condition

date.title: On Date Condition

period.title: Period

unit.title: Time Unit
unit.description: The unit of time for the period.

items.title: Task Dependency
items.description: Used to indicate that a task is dependent on another task.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a unique task.

items.title: Associated Activity
items.description: Identifies an individual activity to be performed as part of a task.

activity-uuid.title: Activity Universally Unique Identifier Reference

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:r.title: Reviewed Controls and Control Objectives

description.title: Control Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of control objectives.

description.title: Control Objectives Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this collection of control objectives.

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:s.title: Select Control
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:s.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

items.title: Include Specific Statements
items.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificity identified statements.

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:s.title: Select Objective
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:s.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier for a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task. The locally defined UUID of the assessment subject placeholder can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). description.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Description
description.description: A human-readable description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

items.title: Assessment Subject Source

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
task-uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference (in this or other OSCAL instances) an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. The locally defined UUID of the task can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.title: Subject of Assessment
oscal-complete-oscal-assessment-common:a.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out-of-scope.

type.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type

subject-uuid.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

title.title: Assessment Platform Title

items.title: Uses Component

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.
